title: [VSA] Project search should differentiate between projects with the same name
description:
### Problem to solve

In group-level VSA, when searching for a Project in the drop-down filter, it can be difficult to know whether you are selecting the correct project in the case of projects with the same name.  For example, search for "gitlab runner" and at least 2 options will be displayed.  It is not clear which of them might be the one you want to select.

### Proposal

In group-level VSA, when searching for a Project in the drop-down filter, the project path should be displayed under the project name.

### Related links

- This proposal came from @gweaver in Slack#g_manage_analytics on 2020-09-15: "It’s hard to know what project I’ve selected from the project dropdown because there are duplicates and no path to help me understand if it is the right project"

### Screenshot

![Screen_Shot_2020-09-15_at_10.30.45_AM](/uploads/91136a737d67602a9351ade7975bd1bd/Screen_Shot_2020-09-15_at_10.30.45_AM.png)

title: [VSA] Filters not working for custom stages
description:
### Problem to solve

> I can’t get the [VSA] filtering to work. After setting up my basic [custom] stages, then filtering by a label... nothing changes. [from @gweaver in Slack#g_manage_analytics](https://gitlab.slack.com/archives/CJZR6KPB4/p1600182001087800)

### Proposal

In VSA, fix the filters so they are applied to custom stages.

### Related links

- [Board that Gabe wants to replicate in VSA](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/boards/1235826?&label_name[]=devops%3A%3Aplan&label_name[]=group%3A%3Aproject%20management)

### Implementation outline

title: Parse scan object from Security Report
description:
### Problem to solve

Add additional data (in a backwards compatible way) about the scanner in the findings details to help troubleshooting self-managed instances and dot-com instances. If the new data is not present, show the old data only.

### Proposal

Once the `scan` object will be added to the JSON report (#37123, #202053, and #202054) we can parse this information.

### Permissions and Security

no changes

## Implementation plan
This issue is scoped with MR widget, https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/196979#note_331665213. Standalone vulnerability changed will be handled by another issue

* [ ] parse new `scan` object
* [x] update fixtures for scanners to reflect new format


### Documentation

There should be nothing to update here, please double check.

### Testing

Add these new properties to automated tests about parsing and API content.

### What does success look like, and how can we measure that?

API exposes additional data provided by the `scan` object from the JSON report: scanner version and scanner url.

### What is the type of buyer? 

~"GitLab Ultimate"

title: dependency_scanning: shouldn't set `dependencies: []`
description:
### Ask

Please update documentation so that users understand what we are doing (for speed and efficiency), there is a separate backlog item to change the behaviour.

Don't let a local optimization (template hardcoded `dependencies: []`) prevent a more global one provided by GitLab's [Directed Acyclic Graphs](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/directed_acyclic_graph).

### Summary

Contrarily to [`sast`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/master/lib/gitlab/ci/templates/Security/SAST.gitlab-ci.yml#L17) for instance, `dependency_scanning` sets [`dependencies` to an empty array](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/lib/gitlab/ci/templates/Security/Dependency-Scanning.gitlab-ci.yml#L24).

This is annoying when favoring [Directed Acyclic Graphs](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/directed_acyclic_graph) because one  can't use `needs` to define upstream job(s) artifacts and has therefore to resort to override `dependencies`.

### Steps to reproduce

1. In a first `stage`, have an *upstream job* archiving some artifacts
2. In a second `stage`, add any of the `dependency_scanning` jobs (s.a. `gemnasium-maven-dependency_scanning`) to the pipeline definition
3. With `needs: [<upstream job>]`:
   1. Override (or extend) the above job so that it `needs: [<upstream job>]` artifacts
   2. Run the pipeline
   3. When run, the `dependency_scanning` job **does not retrieve artifacts** from *upstream job*
4. With `dependencies: [<upstream job>]`:
   1. Now, change the above job by replacing `needs:` with `dependencies:`
   2. Run the pipeline
   3. When run, the `dependency_scanning` job now **retrieves artifacts** from *upstream job*

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

`needs` doesn't work for `dependency_scanning` jobs.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

`needs` should work for `dependency_scanning` jobs.

### Possible fixes

Remove [`dependencies` from `dependency_scanning`](`https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/lib/gitlab/ci/templates/Security/Dependency-Scanning.gitlab-ci.yml#L24`).

### Implementation plan

Note: see comment https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/249569#note_436961514 We can't quickly address this issue so the first step is to add a note to documentation:

1. Add note to https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/application_security/dependency_scanning/#limitations that `dependency_scanning` doesn't work with DAG right now.
1. Add a link to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/257949 to show when I will be fixed.

title: merge_request event field tag name inconsistent with other system hook events
description:
<!--

* Use this issue template for suggesting new docs or updates to existing docs.
  Note: Doc work as part of feature development is covered in the Feature Request template.

* For issues related to features of the docs.gitlab.com site, see
     https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-docs/issues/

* For information about documentation content and process, see
     https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/ -->

### Problem to solve

<!-- Include the following detail as necessary:
* What product or feature(s) affected?
* What docs or doc section affected? Include links or paths.
* Is there a problem with a specific document, or a feature/process that's not addressed sufficiently in docs?
* Any other ideas or requests?
-->

_System hooks_ document is affected, in particular the `merge_request` event.

### Further details

<!--
* Any concepts, procedures, reference info we could add to make it easier to successfully use GitLab?
* Include use cases, benefits, and/or goals for this work.
* If adding content: What audience is it intended for? (What roles and scenarios?)
  For ideas, see personas at https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/ or the persona labels at
  https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/labels?utf8=%E2%9C%93&subscribed=&search=persona%3A
-->

All JSON examples on the _System hooks_ page use a field named `event_name` to identify which event has taken place.

However, the documentation for the `merge_request` event uses `object_kind` as a field name.

https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/system_hooks/system_hooks.html#merge-request-events

### Proposal

<!-- Further specifics for how can we solve the problem. -->

Change the implementation of the generated JSON for merge request events to `event_name` to be consistent with the other events (if indeed the generated JSON _is_ `object_kind` rather than `event_name`).

### Who can address the issue

<!-- What if any special expertise is required to resolve this issue? -->

### Other links/references

<!-- E.g. related GitLab issues/MRs -->

https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/system_hooks/system_hooks.html#merge-request-events

This relates to existing tickets about the documentation for the _System hooks_ page:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/217221
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/216515

This new issue created is extracting an issue from a comment in #217221 :

https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/217221#note_348598464

I've created two MRs for this page:

1. https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/42085
2. https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/42342

description:
The following discussion from !41995 should be addressed:

- [ ] @pgascouvaillancourt started a [discussion](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/41995#note_412407488):  (+1 comment)

    > **praise:** I like that you dropped `.setData` in favor of setting the component's data in the mount function's options.
    > 
    > Do we still need this comment though? Considering that this conforms to the guidelines, is it worth mentioning?

Rather than using `setData`, `mock-apollo-client` can be used to mock the request. This also tests more of the implementation (e.g., `update` handlers).

## Affected files

- `ee/spec/frontend/security_configuration/sast/components/app_spec.js`

title: "Could not retrieve the pipeline status" appears for merged MRs that only have a pipeline for merge requests
description:
### Summary

`Could not retrieve the pipeline status` appears for merged MRs that only have a pipeline configured to run for a source branch i.e. a pipeline is ran only after merging.

### Steps to reproduce

- create a project a configure the pipelines to run only on `master` i.e.

```
test_job:
  script: echo
  only: [master]
```

- create a new branch, create an MR based on this branch and merge this MR
- you will get an error `Could not retrieve the pipeline status` shown in UI

### Example Project

https://gitlab.com/atanayno/mr-pipeline-test/-/merge_requests/1

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

The error `Could not retrieve the pipeline status. For troubleshooting steps, read the documentation.` is shown in the MR pipeline widget.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

The link to the pipeline should be shown instead of the error.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![Screen_Shot_2020-09-15_at_3.53.22_PM](/uploads/c5efd1b51db82bf501e16b6e45469ea8/Screen_Shot_2020-09-15_at_3.53.22_PM.png)

### Output of checks

This bug happens on GitLab.com

### Possible fixes

It happens because `has_ci?` method returns `false` for such merge requests, see https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/models/merge_request.rb#L1202.

<!-- If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem. -->

Affecting:
- SMB Bronze Customer: https://gitlab.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/186581 (internal)

title: Improve MR Experience for Secure Scans on Non-Ultimate Plans - Create feature flag and render CE version of grouped_security_reports_app.vue
description:
## Architecture notes

Looked at https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/ee_features.html#vue-code-in-assetsjavascript

Note: We are implementing this feature **backwards**. We aren't building on-top of CE features. We are back-porting EE to CE features, which complicates things a bit. I also looked at https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/ee_features.html#recommended-alternative-approach-namedscoped-slots

Was told my PM that Secure  MR widgets will go away soon into it's own tab section. So this will all be throwaway code anyway.

It seemed like the best approach was to create a new CE only Vuex module that contains a subset of logic of the EE version. Because `import eeCode from 'ee_else_ce/ee_code';` pulls in the EE version and overrides the CE version, we end up with two versions of code.

Normally if we had been building on the CE version, in the EE version we'd merge in the CE code. We are doing this backwards since we are backporting. Ideally, we'd move the EE logic we need to CE, and then consume it in CE andEE, **BUT** that overhead is overkill since we are throwing away all the Secure MR widgets for a new tab. (So I was told by PM)

## Implementation Plan

- [ ] Create feature flag called `ce_sast_mr_ui`
- [ ] Port grouped_security_reports_app.vue to render only SAST related view components
- [ ] This is an integration MR so invoking the parent component will wire up and use the store, actions, mutations
- [ ] Add unit tests

Normally if we had been building on the CE version, in the EE version we'd merge in the CE code. We are doing this backwards since we are backporting. Ideally, we'd move the EE logic we need to CE, and then consume it in CE andEE, **BUT** that overhead is overkill since we are throwing away all the Secure MR widgets for a new tab. (So I was told by PM)

## Implementation Plan

- [ ] Create Vuex Module skeleton to house the CE version of security reports
- [ ] From ee/app/assets/javascripts/vue_shared/security_reports/store/modules/sast and ee/app/assets/javascripts/vue_shared/security_reports/store/state.js replicate required fields for SAST only.
- [ ] Add unit tests

epic.title: Security Row with SAST vuln count only + artifact downloads

title: Productivity Analytics: Use similarity search option for GraphQL projects queries
description:
### Problem to solve

Under https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/233501 we introduced the "similarity search option" for projects to the GraphQL API.  This provides much better results when searching for projects by name.  However, this option is not yet being used on the ~frontend.

### Proposal

The ~frontend for Productivity Analytics should switch to the GrapqhQL API for project queries and should use the similarity search option when searching projects by name.

### Related links

- This issue was prompted by this discussion: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/233501#note_408569173

title: dependency_scanning + sbt: shouldn't use `ivyReport` with sbt 1.3.0+
description:
### Summary

How much effort is it to support both sbt 1.3.0+ and the older version (as we do today) as there are changes to the way it worked? [timebox]

Since [sbt 1.3.0](https://github.com/sbt/sbt/releases/tag/v1.3.0) (Sep 4, 2019), [Coursier](https://get-coursier.io/) became the default dependency management library, replacing [Apache Ivy](https://ant.apache.org/ivy/).

`gemnasium-maven-dependency_scanning` happens to use `ivyReport` to gather the project dependencies without considering the underlying dependency management library, which doesn't work with sbt 1.3.0+ unless `Coursier` is explicitly disabled (`ThisBuild / useCoursier := false`).

### Steps to reproduce

Have the `gemnasium-maven-dependency_scanning` job run on a sbt 1.3.0+ project (not disabling `Coursier`!), for instance with the following `project/build.properties` file:
```properties
sbt.version=1.3.13
```

### Example Project

Any existing project may be quickly given a try by changing its `sbt.version` as described above.

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

`sbt ivyReport` then `sbt -no-colors show ivyReport` (misleadingly?) report successes, but post-processing their output fails because no report got actually generated:
```
[FATA] [gemnasium-maven] [<timestamp>] ▶ open /builds/<path>/target/scala-<scalaCompatVersion>/resolution-cache/reports/<groupId>.<artifactId>_<scalaCompatVersion>-compile.xml: no such file or directory
```

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

`gemnasium-maven-dependency_scanning` doesn't make use of `ivyReport` when detecting a sbt 1.3.0+ project (or by querying `sbt`'s active dependency management library).

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

```
[INFO] [gemnasium-maven] [<timestamp>] ▶ Identified sbt project
[DEBU] [gemnasium-maven] [<timestamp>] ▶ /opt/asdf/shims/sbt ivyReport
[info] [launcher] getting org.scala-sbt sbt 1.3.<patch>  (this may take some time)...
:: loading settings :: url = jar:file:/opt/asdf/installs/sbt/1.3.8/bin/sbt-launch.jar!/org/apache/ivy/core/settings/ivysettings.xml
:: retrieving :: org.scala-sbt#boot-app
	confs: [default]
	<number> artifacts copied, 0 already retrieved
[info] Loading settings for project <artifactId> from <sbtFiles> ...
[info] Resolving key references (<number> settings) ...
[info] Set current project to <artifactId> (in build file:/builds/<path>/)
[success] Total time: <duration>, completed <dateTime>
[DEBU] [gemnasium-maven] [<timestamp>] ▶ /opt/asdf/shims/sbt -no-colors show ivyReport
[info] Loading settings for project <artifactId> from <sbtFiles> ...
[info] Resolving key references (<number> settings) ...
[info] Set current project to <artifactId> (in build file:/builds/<path>/)
[info] <artifactId> / Compile / ivyReport
[info] 	/builds/<path>/target/scala-<scalaCompatVersion>/resolution-cache/reports/<groupId>-<artifactId>_<scalaCompatVersion>-compile.xml
[success] Total time: <duration>, completed <dateTime>
[FATA] [gemnasium-maven] [<timestamp>] ▶ open /builds/<path>/target/scala-<scalaCompatVersion>/resolution-cache/reports/<groupId>.<artifactId>_<scalaCompatVersion>-compile.xml: no such file or directory
Uploading artifacts for failed job
00:00
Uploading artifacts...
WARNING: gl-dependency-scanning-report.json: no matching files 
ERROR: No files to upload                          
ERROR: Job failed: exit code 1
```

### Possible fixes

If possible, instead of using `ivyReport`, gather dependencies in a generic way (independent from the underlying dependency manager), for instance with one of:
1. `allDependencies`
2. `dependencyDot`
3. `dependencyList`
4. `dependencyTree`
5. `dependencyBrowseTree` (:warning: not headless)
6. `projectDependencies`

If not, determine whether active dependency manager is `Ivy` or `Coursier`:
1. `Ivy`: keep using `ivyReport`
2. `Coursier`: either by means of one of the above dependency manager independent tasks, or by means of the `sbt-coursier` plugin

**EDIT:** For sbt *at least*, the best alternative I'm aware of consists in leveraging the [`sbt-dependency-check` plugin](https://github.com/albuch/sbt-dependency-check) which is based on the quite powerful [OWASP `dependency-check`](https://owasp.org/www-project-dependency-check/), which in turn automatically updates itself using [NVD Data Feeds](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/data-feeds).

title: Incorrect access_level permissions returned by group members API & UI when listing all members including inherited members
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

When using [`GET /groups/:id/members/all`](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/members.html#list-all-members-of-a-group-or-project-including-inherited-members)
`access_level` is not properly inherited from parent groups. UI shows wrong effective `access_level`.

<!-- Summarize the bug encountered concisely. -->

### Steps to reproduce

1. create a group `parent`
1. create a group `sub` in the `parent` namespace
1. in the group `sub` add a member with an `access_level` of `20` (Reporter)
1. in the group `parent` add same member with an `access_level` of `30` (Developer)

Note that `3.` and `4.` steps should not be swapped because this would show a validation error.

<!-- Describe how one can reproduce the issue - this is very important. Please use an ordered list. -->

### Example groups

* `parent`: https://gitlab.com/groups/b-test-parent/-/group_members
* `sub`: https://gitlab.com/groups/b-test-parent/sub/-/group_members

<!-- If possible, please create an example project here on GitLab.com that exhibits the problematic 
behavior, and link to it here in the bug report. If you are using an older version of GitLab, this 
will also determine whether the bug is fixed in a more recent version. -->

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

* if you run `GET /groups/:id/members/all` on `sub` group you'll see `access_level` `20` (Reporter) for the member rather than expected `30` (Developer)
   ```json
   [{
        "id": 5332,
        "name": "Ben Bodenmiller",
        "username": "bbodenmiller",
        "state": "active",
        "avatar_url": "https://assets.gitlab-static.net/uploads/-/system/user/avatar/5332/avatar.png",
        "web_url": "https://gitlab.com/bbodenmiller",
        "access_level": 50,
        "expires_at": null
    },
    {
        "id": 331646,
        "name": "🙈  jacopo beschi 🙉",
        "username": "jacopo-beschi",
        "state": "active",
        "avatar_url": "https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/692fb66988ac3863f360e846c1afc4f3?s=80&d=identicon",
        "web_url": "https://gitlab.com/jacopo-beschi",
        "access_level": 20,
        "expires_at": null
    }]
   ```
* check the group `sub` members UI you'll see `access_level` `20` (Reporter) for the member rather than expected `30` (Developer)

<!-- Describe what actually happens. -->

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

* if you run `GET /groups/:id/members/all` on `sub` group you see `access_level` `30` (Developer) for the member
* check the group `sub` members UI you see `access_level` `30` (Developer) for the member

<!-- Describe what you should see instead. -->

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

<!-- Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output, logs, and code
 as it's tough to read otherwise. -->

### Output of checks

This bug happens on GitLab.com

### Possible fixes

Related to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/-/issues/62284 and https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/-/merge_requests/28887.

Perhaps something in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/finders/group_members_finder.rb needs to be changed similar to in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/-/merge_requests/28887?

* [ ] Remove caution text added in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/42305

<!-- If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem. -->

title: In the DAST site profile and scanner profile lists, the Delete buttons don't have tooltips
description:
GitLab's DAST feature allows the user to create site profiles and scanner profiles. If a user wants to delete one of them, they navigate to the list of profiles and click on the button which features a trash can icon. However, there is no tooltip. The lack of a tooltip is an accessibility issue.

For reference, the documentation for deleting a site profile can be found at:

https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/application_security/dast/#delete-a-site-profile

**Suggestion**

Add a tooltip for each button:

- Site profile: `Delete profile`.
- Scanner profile: `Delete profile`.

title: Unit Test Report: Test cases with 'Errored' status show skipped icon
description:
### Summary In the list of test cases in the Unit Test Report, the status icon for the `Errored` cases looks like a skipped test icon: ![Screen_Shot_2020-09-14_at_18.01.48](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/bb06156000636ad900f1edf85709d19d/Screen_Shot_2020-09-14_at_18.01.48.png) We never defined an icon for the errored status and [the skipped icon is the default icon](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/pipelines/stores/test_reports/utils.js#L9). Here are the statuses and icons we have defined: | status | icon | | ------ | ------ | | `success` | `status_success_borderless` | | `failed` | `status_failed_borderless` | | anything else | `status_skipped_borderless` | And here are the [`status_` GitLab SVGs](https://gitlab-org.gitlab.io/gitlab-svgs/?q=status_) that we can work with. ### Steps to reproduce 1. Run a pipeline with at least one unit test that throws an error at runtime 1. Wait for the pipeline to finish 1. Navigate to the pipeline page and click on the Tests tab 1. Click into the suite that the unit test that throws an error belongs to 1. The errored test case should be at the top of the list ### Example Project ### What is the current *bug* behavior? The icon for the errored test case looks like a skipped case's icon (like `>>`) ### What is the expected *correct* behavior? The icon for the errored test case should represent the status better, maybe with a red `X` like the failed tests or an orange exclamation point `!` like a "passed with warnings" pipeline does ### Relevant logs and/or screenshots ### Output of checks #### Results of GitLab environment info
Expand for output related to GitLab environment info 

(For installations with omnibus-gitlab package run and paste the output of:
`sudo gitlab-rake gitlab:env:info`)

(For installations from source run and paste the output of:
`sudo -u git -H bundle exec rake gitlab:env:info RAILS_ENV=production`)
#### Results of GitLab application Check
Expand for output related to the GitLab application check 

(For installations with omnibus-gitlab package run and paste the output of:
`sudo gitlab-rake gitlab:check SANITIZE=true`)

(For installations from source run and paste the output of:
`sudo -u git -H bundle exec rake gitlab:check RAILS_ENV=production SANITIZE=true`)

(we will only investigate if the tests are passing)
### Possible fixes

title: Add sorting to security dashboard columns: All columns (except Severity & Identifier)
description:
See [Design Issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/222448/designs/z03_sorting-details.png7) and parent Epics for details.


## Additional information

The severity column sorting is part of the scope of https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/230383. 
The complete requirements outlined in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/222448/ support sorting by ALL columns. This issue represents the addition of sorting functionality to columns other than the Severity column & the Identifier column (which have been split into separate issues). 

## Implementation Plan

- [x] ~backend Add scopes to sorting (https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/4f3c356688c04f1456e5beee4dad073023111a25/ee/app/models/vulnerability.rb#L82):
  - [x] `order_detected_at_asc`/`order_detected_at_desc` (use `created_at` column to sort)
  - [x] `order_state_asc`/`order_state_desc` (use `state` column to sort, will require special logic to return it in preferred order: `Detected`>`Confirmed`>`Resolved`>`Dismissed`)
  - [x] `order_title_asc`/`order_title_desc` (use `title` column to sort)
  - [ ] ~~`order_identifier_asc`/`order_identifier_desc` (will require additional work and query to specify the main identifier to use in sorting, also this is a field from another table that will be joined with `vulnerabilities`),~~
  - [x] `order_report_type_asc`/`order_report_desc` (use `report_type` column to sort, will require special logic to do it alphabetically)
- [x] ~backend Extend `Vulnerability.order_by` method to support new order options: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/4f3c356688c04f1456e5beee4dad073023111a25/ee/app/models/vulnerability.rb#L134
- [x] ~backend Extend `Types::VulnerabilitySortEnum` enum to support new order options: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/546da4714a09a35f67b4150d6ecf2e78f3c297c7/ee/app/graphql/types/vulnerability_sort_enum.rb#L8
- [x] ~frontend add `sortable: this.isSortable` to the fields we'd like to be sortable

## Additional context

The `app/assets/javascripts/alert_management/components/alert_management_table.vue` file has an example implementation on how to sort a column. Fortunately the `gl-table` has support for sorting so we just need to implement the sorting function.

title: 500's / Statement Timeout on Merge Request List
description:
Frequently, when using the merge request list to search back by a few pages and then using the sorting (and other filters), a 500 error will be shown. This issue in particular was not caused by the filters or other sorting attributes, but just sorting by "created at" 


Link to the same error in Kibana: [Internal Only](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover/doc/AW5F1e45qthdGjPJueGO/pubsub-rails-inf-gprd-003416?id=CGhQjXQB3pIbg4mpRwEX)

To reproduce:

1. Visit the merge request page and search by something. My search was "merge request filter." 
1. Sort by created, either asc or desc

Link to the 500 page in this case: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests?scope=all&search=merge+request+filter&sort=created_asc&state=opened&utf8=%E2%9C%93

If it does not 500 for you, try sorting in the opposite direction. There is an increase in latency which sometimes times out.

https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/gitlabcom/issues/1817982/?referrer=gitlab_plugin

title: Group migration - Instrument usage ping (Import GMAU)
description:
## Problem
In https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/manage/general-discussion/-/issues/17232, we described the need for a Group MAU for Import. This should be a measure of the number of unique users taking an action that is important to the goals of the group.

## Proposal
* Add the number of unique users importing groups using the new [API-based group import](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/4374) to usage ping.
* This number will count all attempted imports (not successful completion).
* This count should be distinct from the [current Group imports]((https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/235426)) (using file-based group exports), so that we can tell them apart.

title: Group migration MVC - Contributor Documentation
description:
We need to clearly document the GitLab Group Migration functionality available as of the completion of the [MVC epic](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/4374), as a distinct feature from the [Group Import from an export file](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/group/settings/import_export.html).

The feature should be labeled as `early`, `beta`, `lab`, or some other pattern that calls out the fact that it is bare-bones and may not be useful enough for most users.

title: Group migration - Import one group - frontend
description:
As part of the [GitLab Group Migration MVC](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/4374) epic, this issue will add the ability to initiate end execute **import of one group from the list**, as discussed in [this comment](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/4374#note_412279623).

#### Designs

Designs and prototype posted in the issue **UX for GitLab Group Migration - MVC** https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/237925

title: Group migration - Import one group - backend
description:
This is part of the [Group Migration MVC](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/4374).

## Goal

To import a single group, and all it's subgroups using the new API based approach

### Notes

Additional information from: https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/4374#note_412279623

> Create Group ETL pipeline that uses both REST and GraphQL extractors. First, for selected group, fetch all sub group 'full paths' as our current GraphQL API does not provide subgroups in Group type (something that we should expand perhaps?). We will probably have to build group hierachy in memory as REST API flattens the response. Then for each group use GraphQL client to fetch its data.

title: Group migration - Show available groups - frontend
description:
As part of the [GitLab Group Migration MVC](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/4374) epic, this issue will add the ability to **show a list of top-level groups** available for import, as discussed in [this comment](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/4374#note_412279623).

The list will contain the source group path/name, (editable) destination group path/name, status of the import, and the import button.

#### Out of scope
Solving pagination/infinite scrolling for long lists of groups is not in the scope of this issue.

#### Designs

Designs and prototype posted in the issue **UX for GitLab Group Migration - MVC** https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/237925

title: Migrate GlNewDropdownDivider to GlDropdownDivider
description:
**GitLab UI** [recently removed](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ui/-/releases/v21.0.0#breaking-changes) `GlNew*` aliases for all dropdown-related components.

To be able to upgrade to the latest version of `@gitlab/ui` in GitLab, we need to remove all references to deprecated `GlNew*` imports.

This issues focuses on replacing `GlNewDropdownDivider` imports with `GlDropdownDivider`.

title: Migrate GlNewDropdownText and GlNewDropdown
description:

To be able to upgrade to the latest version of `@gitlab/ui` in GitLab, we need to remove all references to deprecated `GlNew*` imports.

This issues focuses on replacing `GlNewDropdownText` and `GlNewDropdown` imports with `GlDropdownText` and `GlDropdown`.

When embarking on the DAG feature for the very first time, users feel lost due to the lack of accessible cues to start using it. 

- DAG name is unclear, many users are not familiar with it. 
- There's not enough guidance in the UI about what the DAG viz. feature is and how to start using it, and why.

title: Roll out `:monaco_ci` feature flag
description:
## What

After deploying [Replace ACE with Editor Lite for `/-/ci/lint` CI Linting](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/198606) behind the `:monaco_ci` feature flag, the feature should be rolled out with the feature flag enabled by default. It is suggested to roll out globally to all users because the presence of the feature flag secures easy rollback should something go wrong.

## Owners

* Team: Create::Editor (Frontend)
* Most appropriate slack channel to reach out to: `#g_create_editor`
* Best individual to reach out to: @dmishunov

## Expectations

### What are we expecting to happen?

The CI linting view (`/-/ci/lint`) should render Editor Lite (Monaco-based) instead of ACE

### What might happen if this goes wrong?

Potential bugs in functionality that should either be addressed fast or the feature flag should be rolled back while it's available


## Roll Out Steps

* [x] Enable on staging
* [x] Test on staging
* [x] ~~Ensure that documentation has been updated~~ not needed as there are no changes in the feature per se
* [x] Coordinate a time to enable the flag with `#production` and `#g_delivery` on slack.
* [x] Announce on the issue an estimated time this will be enabled on GitLab.com
* [x] Enable on GitLab.com by running chatops command in `#production`
* [x] Cross post chatops slack command to `#support_gitlab-com` and in your team channel
* [x] Announce on the issue that the flag has been enabled

The following step belongs to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/198612

* [ ] Enable the flag by default in the codebase

The following steps belong to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/198609

* [ ] Remove feature flag and add changelog entry
* [ ] After the flag removal is deployed, [clean up the feature flag](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up) by running chatops command in `#production` channel

### Availability and Testing

Important: please run `package-and-qa` job before the feature flag in enabled by default. Please also coordinate your changes with the SET (@a_mcdonald) as some further refactoring will need to be implemented as soon as the ff is enabled (see https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/quality/team-tasks/-/issues/492#note_335592893).

title: Revert the change for making the web-ide our preferred experience for editing .gitlab-ci.yml
description: As [agreed](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/247483) we want the Editor Lite to be our preferred experience for editing .gitlab-ci.yml, therefore, its best we'll revert the change made in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/232779

title: Failure to authenticate to container registry with project access token
description:
### Summary When you create a [project access token](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/settings/project_access_tokens.html), you'll end up with a `project__bot` user and its access token. You're unable to authenticate against the GitLab Container Registry with this user, facing the following error: ``` Error response from daemon: Get https://gitlab.domain.com:5050/v2/: unauthorized: HTTP Basic: Access denied. ``` ### Steps to reproduce 1. Create a project 1. Add a project access token with relevant scopes for registry 1. Confirm project__bot is added as member to project 1. Attempt to login to the container registry with `docker login ...` ### Example Project ### What is the current *bug* behavior? Error: ``` Error response from daemon: Get https://gitlab.domain.com:5050/v2/: unauthorized: HTTP Basic: Access denied. ``` ### What is the expected *correct* behavior? Login succeeded. ### Relevant logs and/or screenshots ### Output of checks todo: > If you are reporting a bug on GitLab.com, write: This bug happens on GitLab.com #### Results of GitLab environment info
Expand for output related to GitLab environment info 

(For installations with omnibus-gitlab package run and paste the output of:
`sudo gitlab-rake gitlab:env:info`)

(For installations from source run and paste the output of:
`sudo -u git -H bundle exec rake gitlab:env:info RAILS_ENV=production`)
#### Results of GitLab application Check
Expand for output related to the GitLab application check 

(For installations with omnibus-gitlab package run and paste the output of:
`sudo gitlab-rake gitlab:check SANITIZE=true`)

(For installations from source run and paste the output of:
`sudo -u git -H bundle exec rake gitlab:check RAILS_ENV=production SANITIZE=true`)

(we will only investigate if the tests are passing)
### Possible fixes

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Issues that we want to do but are not planned right now. Open for contribution from the community.

title: Elasticsearch reindexing should restore the original `refresh_interval`
description:
Currently, our elasticsearch [zero-downtime reindexing feature](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/integration/elasticsearch.html#trigger-the-reindex-via-the-elasticsearch-administration) sets `refresh_interval` to `10s` for the duration of reindexing and sets it to `nil` (the default value, `1s`) after the process is finished.

If an instance admin changed it to something non-default, we would effectively overwrite the `refresh_interval` which might be not ideal. I believe we should save the original `refresh_interval` and restore it after reindexing is done.

title: [BE] Implement blob's resolver
description:
At the moment, when the web IDE needs to retrieve information about a file's blob, it performs a query to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/b381e7cef6dc8a20891ce260b38452953a9f96ed/changelogs/archive-10-ee.md?format=json&viewer=none.

The information that needs to be returned is:

```text
{"id":"21ee4cd59be7c77807443a7ee3147918d78d085f","last_commit_sha":"098127227f7e9db3a92e7989a29a61103060b5b5","path":"changelogs/archive-10-ee.md","name":"archive-10-ee.md","extension":"md","size":44985,"mime_type":"text/markdown","binary":false,"simple_viewer":"text","rich_viewer":"markup","show_viewer_switcher":true,"render_error":null,"raw_path":"/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/raw/b381e7cef6dc8a20891ce260b38452953a9f96ed/changelogs/archive-10-ee.md","blame_path":"/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blame/b381e7cef6dc8a20891ce260b38452953a9f96ed/changelogs/archive-10-ee.md","commits_path":"/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/commits/b381e7cef6dc8a20891ce260b38452953a9f96ed/changelogs/archive-10-ee.md","tree_path":"/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/tree/b381e7cef6dc8a20891ce260b38452953a9f96ed/changelogs","permalink":"/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/b381e7cef6dc8a20891ce260b38452953a9f96ed/changelogs/archive-10-ee.md"}
```

We could reuse the existing the existing [Snippet's blob type](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/master/app/graphql/types/snippets/blob_type.rb#L6).

title: Reporter level not enough for browsing package lists
description:
### Summary

When trying to browse the packages for a group where I have "Reporter" access, I get the following error message in the UI:

> Something went wrong while fetching the packages list.

According to https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/permissions.html should be enough to pull packages but the same doesn't seem to be the case for browsing the package list.


### Steps to reproduce

1. Get a user with "Reporter" level access to a group
2. Go to the packages listing on that group


### Example Project

https://gitlab.com/gitlab-permissue (just ping me so that I can invite you :))

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Right now, the UI returns an error message indicating lack of permissions.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Reporter level should (?) have browse access to the packages also within the UI.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

 as it's tough to read otherwise. -->

title: Add test coverage to ensure scanner-profiles and site-profiles return 404 when edited with a non-existing id
description:
The following discussion from !41255 should be addressed:

- [ ] @ashmckenzie started a [discussion](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/41255#note_411918711): 

    > suggestion: We should probably have coverage for editing a non-existing scanner profile ID.

This also applies to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/spec/requests/projects/security/dast_site_profiles_controller_spec.rb, since the scanner-profiles work is based on it and the two behave very similarly.

title: Change the Redis key format for Redis HLL events
description:
Opening a follow up issue to improve the Redis key naming.

Currently we have documentation guidance we could have also some code restrictions or keys built automatically on a given format. 


The following discussion from !41975 should be addressed:

- [ ] @jameslopez started a [discussion](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/41975#note_411008440):  (+3 comments)

    > Silly question, but have we consider using further namespaces? Something like `gitlab:group:tracking_event` or similar :thinking: that way we don't have to check the docs to see what the prefix means...

   > @alinamihaila I was talking about the Redis key itself, I'm not sure how this works with the `known_events.yml` :thinking:

We normally prefix all Redis keys with `gitlab:` so that might already be there. An attribute in `known_events.yml` might do as well, such as `type` or similar - i.e `type: group`.

The key itself could be renamed, but I'm not sure how easy is to do that...

To keep in mind about renaming keys in Redis 

https://redis.io/commands/rename

https://redis.io/commands/renamenx

> In Cluster mode, both key and newkey must be in the same hash slot, meaning that in practice only keys that have the same hash tag can be reliably renamed in cluster.

cc @gitlab-org/growth/telemetry/engineers

title: Investigate why some GitlabSubscriptions are without Namespace
description:

title: Roll out graphql_board_lists feature flag
description:
<!-- Title suggestion: [Feature flag] Enable description of feature -->

## What

Remove the `:graphql_board_lists` feature flag

## Owners

- Team: Plan
- Most appropriate slack channel to reach out to: `#s_plan`
- Best individual to reach out to: @fguibert, @cablett, @jprovaznik, @euko, @psimyn 

## Expectations

### What are we expecting to happen?

Boards are using GraphQL endpoints and VueX with no visual or behavioural changes from the current REST API implementation.

### What might happen if this goes wrong?

The only risk is possible regressions on boards.

### What can we monitor to detect problems with this?

<!-- Which dashboards from https://dashboards.gitlab.net are most relevant? -->

## Beta groups/projects

If applicable, any groups/projects that are happy to have this feature turned on early. Some organizations may wish to test big changes they are interested in with a small subset of users ahead of time for example.

* https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/plan-stage (group/project issue boards)
* https://gitlab.com/tech-marketing/demos/gitlab-agile-demo/large-co/sector-alpha/lob-1/app-a (group issue boards)
* https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/boards (project issue boards)
* https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/boards (group issue boards)
* https://gitlab.com/euko/test-project-plan (project issue board / namespaced to a free-tier user account)

Please open bug issues and place them under this epic https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/5596.


## Rollout Steps

### Rollout on non-production environments

- [x] Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to non-production environments.
    - [ ] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-your-feature>`
- [x] Enable the feature globally on non-production environments.
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set graphql_board_lists true --dev`
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set graphql_board_lists true --staging`
- [x] Verify that the feature works as expected. Posting the QA result in this issue is preferable.

### Preparation before production rollout

- [x] Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to both production and canary.
    - [ ] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-your-feature>`
- [-] Check if the feature flag change needs to be accompanied with a
  [change management issue](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/change-management/#feature-flags-and-the-change-management-process).
  Cross link the issue here if it does.
- [x] Ensure that you or a representative in development can be available for at least 2 hours after feature flag updates in production.
  If a different developer will be covering, or an exception is needed, please inform the oncall SRE by using the `@sre-oncall` Slack alias.
- [x] Ensure that documentation has been updated ([More info](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/feature_flags.html#features-that-became-enabled-by-default)).
    - !61682
- [ ] Announce on [the feature issue](ISSUE LINK) an estimated time this will be enabled on GitLab.com.
- [ ] If the feature flag in code has [an actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), enable it on GitLab.com for [testing groups/projects](#testing-groupsprojectsusers).
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set --<actor-type>=<actor> <feature-flag-name> true`
- [ ] Verify that the feature works as expected. Posting the QA result in this issue is preferable.

### Global rollout on production

- [x] [Incrementally roll out](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#process) the feature.
  - If the feature flag in code has [an actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), perform **actor-based** rollout.
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set <feature-flag-name> <rollout-percentage> --actors`
  - If the feature flag in code does **NOT** have [an actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), perform time-based rollout (**random** rollout).
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set <feature-flag-name> <rollout-percentage>`
  - Enable the feature globally on production environment.
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set <feature-flag-name> true`
- [x] Announce on [the feature issue](ISSUE LINK) that the feature has been globally enabled.
- [x] Cross-post chatops slack command to `#support_gitlab-com`.
  ([more guidance when this is necessary in the dev docs](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#communicate-the-change)) and in your team channel
- [x] Wait for [at least one day for the verification term](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release).

### (Optional) Release the feature with the feature flag

If you're still unsure whether the feature is [deemed stable](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release)
but want to release it in the current milestone, you can change the default state of the feature flag to be enabled.
To do so, follow these steps:

- [x] Create a merge request with the following changes. Ask for review and merge it.
    - [x] Set the `default_enabled` attribute in [the feature flag definition](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-flag-definition-and-validation) to `true`.
    - [x] Create [a changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#changelog).
- [x] Ensure that the above MR has been deployed to both production and canary.
      If the merge request was deployed before [the code cutoff](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/releases/#self-managed-releases-1),
      the feature can be officially announced in a release blog post.
    - [x] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit>`
- [x] Close [the feature issue](ISSUE LINK) to indicate the feature will be released in the current milestone.

**WARNING:** This approach has the downside that it makes it difficult for us to
[clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up) the flag.
For example, on-premise users could disable the feature on their GitLab instance. But when you
remove the flag at some point, they suddenly see the feature as enabled and they can't roll it back
to the previous behavior. To avoid this potential breaking change, use this approach only for urgent
matters.

### Release the feature

After the feature has been [deemed stable](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release),
the [clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up)
should be done as soon as possible to permanently enable the feature and reduce complexity in the
codebase.

<!-- The checklist here is to help stakeholders keep track of the feature flag status -->
- [x] Create a merge request to remove `<feature-flag-name>` feature flag. Ask for review and merge it.
    - [x] Remove all references to the feature flag from the codebase.
    - [x] Remove tests covering use cases when the feature flag is disabled.
    - [x] Remove the YAML definitions for the feature from the repository.
    - [x] Create [a changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#changelog).
- [x] Ensure that the above MR has been deployed to both production and canary.
      If the merge request was deployed before [the code cutoff](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/releases/#self-managed-releases-1),
      the feature can be officially announced in a release blog post.
    - [x] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit>`
- [x] Close [the feature issue](ISSUE LINK) to indicate the feature will be released in the current milestone.
- [x] Clean up the feature flag from all environments by running these chatops command in `#production` channel:
    - [x] `/chatops run feature delete <feature-flag-name> --dev`
    - [x] `/chatops run feature delete <feature-flag-name> --staging`
    - [x] `/chatops run feature delete <feature-flag-name>`
- [x] Close this rollout issue.

## Rollback Steps

- [ ] This feature can be disabled by running the following Chatops command:

```
/chatops run feature set <feature-flag-name> false
```

title: Dev Research - for contextual code references
description:
In preparation for https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/238540 there is a need to figure out how code references work and if we can find some kind of template that can be used to identify Unleash feature flags in the code.

we can use here is the *pattern* we're using, not necessarily the same `lsif` approach we use with code intelligence. The approach we use is to parse the code to produce a json object that we then know how to index. In this case, if you know the syntax of how a feature flag looks in the code, you could use the parsed/processed data in the backend to send information to the frontend, where we can add some event listeners that will know how to interpret the data.

Following https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/238540#note_406119492 we may need @igor.drozdov to help out here.


The outcome of this research will be to figure out a way to highlight the feature flag context inside the code.

We will start with TBD language

title: Fix sentence splitting in Gitpod message (Gitpod Follow-up)
description:
## Context

The following discussion from !37985 should be addressed:

- [ ] @pslaughter started a [discussion](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/37985#note_411724036): 

    > **suggestion (non-blocking):** According to [our i18n docs](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/i18n/externalization.html#avoid-splitting-sentences-when-adding-links):
    > 
    > > Please never split a sentence as that would assume the sentence grammar and structure is the same in all languages. 
    > 
    > For this reason, we usually have a `link_start` and `link_end` (instead of just `link`) variables for these interpolated translated strings.
    > 
    > ```ruby
    > s_('Enable %{link_start}Gitpod%{link_end} integration to launch a development environment in your browser directly from GitLab.')
    > ```
    > 
    > While we're at it, I see that we have this same paragraph/message in the user preference settings as well. It might be nice to move all of this to some sort of `gitpod_description` method in a helper module.
    > 
    > We can take care of this in a follow-up :smile:

Occurrences:

- `app/views/admin/application_settings/_gitpod.html.haml:3`
- `app/views/profiles/preferences/_gitpod.html.haml:1`
- `app/views/shared/gitpod/_enable_gitpod_modal.html.haml:9`

title: Quick Navigation from Search Bar
description:
### Problem
When searching through GitLab, sometimes you just need to go to a specific project and not a search result page. 

In the Global search bar, you can now quickly jump to Recent Issues, Groups, Projects, Settings, and Help topics. 

![2020-09-12_13.48.12](/uploads/b861f5637e6edcb5b1b1ff888fcd1c47/2020-09-12_13.48.12.gif)


## Details

title: Issue Detail - Frontend Performance Research Spike
description:
We have a Q3 OKR in both [Product](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/Product/-/issues/1344#note_399061808) and [Dev](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/issues/8432) to improve the LCP performance of the top 5 most visited routes on GitLab.com.

Because ~"devops::plan" is awesome, we have two of those top 5 most visited routes: the Issue List and the Issue Detail page. 

This issue represents a research spike to identify actions that we can take on the backend for the Issue Detail to improve the performance of this page. We want to identify actions that we can take in %"13.5" to improve frontend performance. We will likely spend a significant portion of %13.5 implementing these performance improvements.

**Dashboard**: https://dashboards.gitlab.net/d/000000043/sitespeed-page-summary?orgId=1&from=now-30d&to=now&var-base=sitespeed_io&var-path=desktop&var-group=gitlab_com&var-page=_gitlab-org_gitlab-foss_issues_34225&var-browser=chrome&var-connectivity=cable&var-function=median

**Sitespeed report**: https://storage.googleapis.com/sitespeed-results-gitlab/gitlab.com/2020-05-26-03-57-29/pages/gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/issues/34225/index.html

## Done when:
- [ ] We've identified 2-5 frontend performance optimizations for the [Issue Detail page](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/-/issues/34225). 
- [ ] Those optimizations are documented as issues and included in the [epic](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/3347)

----

I know that having a "Research spike" can be a bit nebulous in terms of what success is, and ultimately the goal here is to improve the overall performance of GitLab, so if there are other related issues that you're aware of that help push us towards this goal, feel free to include those here. For example, we're tracking https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/204720 to improve the performance of complex sorts on Issue List. That doesn't directly impact the Sitespeed report metrics, but would still be a big performance win.

title: Assets hyperlinks on Releases page extend entire width of body
description:
### Summary

The clickable hyperlinked area for each Asset listed on the Releases page extends the entire width of the page body (filling the list item container it resides in). This layout makes for easy accidental downloads of assets when clicking in the open whitespace of the page that is actually hyperlinked.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open Releases page
1. Hover mouse over Asset entries
1. Move mouse into whitespace to the right of the Asset text
1. Observe it is still clickable in the whitespace

### Example Project

The behavior happens in the Gitlab project: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab ([Releases](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/releases))

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Whitespace to the right of Asset entries is hyperlinked.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Only the Asset entry text should be hyperlinked.

### Relevant info and screenshots

Anchor width fills entire width of list item:

![image](/uploads/e619a3ec560960e73d5767e66668ffa8/image.png)

##### Version info

- Browser – Chrome Version 84.0.4147.105 (Official Build) (64-bit)
- OS – Windows 10 Build 1709

### Possible fixes

Line 125 of [`release_block_assets.vue`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/d930f7f47f0e79b18b76a2ce8697936db9805d9f/app/assets/javascripts/releases/components/release_block_assets.vue#L125) may be responsible for the problem.

Changing the `gl-display-flex` class to `gl-display-inline-flex` seems to resolve the issue:

```diff
-                  class="gl-display-flex gl-align-items-center gl-line-height-24"
+                  class="gl-display-inline-flex gl-align-items-center gl-line-height-24"
```

title: Ignore invalid values for CiPlatformMetrics
Line numbers in File Blame view sometimes cut off
description:
### Summary

The line number column sometimes renders too narrow in the File Blame view and ends up cutting off digits. Strangely, though, it doesn't always seem to happen for all similarly-sized files.

---

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open a file in the Repository view with 10 or more (or 100 or more) lines
1. Click the "Blame" button
1. Begin to scroll down and observe line numbers start to get cut off as it goes from `9` to `10` (or `99` to `100`)

---

### Example Project

The behavior happens in the Gitlab project: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

The line number column (`<td class="line-numbers">`) is not always wide enough to fit the numbers, resulting in them being cut off from view.

##### Example of *bug* behavior

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blame/master/.gitlab-ci.yml ([permalink](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blame/f5f4e40cbd90b4479b5307eebf1715a92e2944aa/.gitlab-ci.yml)) with 183 lines

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

The line number column should always render as wide as the largest line number in the file.

##### Example of *correct* behavior

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blame/master/.haml-lint.yml ([permalink](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blame/614e6aaf2c62fc22fdf708fd7df1f7ce74f917df/.haml-lint.yml)) with 108 lines

---

### Relevant info and screenshots

##### Screenshot of *bug* behavior

Transition from line 99 to line 100 in `.gitlab-ci.yml` results in truncation:

![image](/uploads/b4447f3861d96046e96e995dbe326831/image.png)

##### Screenshot of *correct* behavior

Transition from line 99 to line 100 in `.haml-lint.yml` is clearly displayed:

![image](/uploads/d34d6c1745615eccc3c3996e5183c0b3/image.png)

##### Version info

- Browser – Chrome Version 84.0.4147.105 (Official Build) (64-bit)
- OS – Windows 10 Build 1709

title: DAST Profiles - Update routes
description:
DAST Profiles management is currently accessible at `/:namespace/:project/-/on_demand_scans/profiles`, placing them under the **On-demand Scans** umbrella, while they should actually belong to the **Security Configuration** namespace.

DAST Profiles have been made accessible via the configuration page with the addition of a **Manage** link in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/40474. We now only need to update the routes so that profiles are accessible at `/:namespace/:project/-/security/configuration/profiles`.

## Implementation plan

- [x] Convert `dast_profiles#index` to `dast_profiles#show` (easier to map in the routes config).
- [x] Update routes definition in `ee/config/routes/project.rb`.
- [x] Move the controllers to the correct scope (`Projects` -> `Projects::Security`).
- [x] Move views, javascripts and specs to the correct locations.
- [x] Update the breadcrumbs in the following views to replace the **On-demand Scans** item with **Security Configuration**:
  - [x] `ee/app/views/projects/dast_scanner_profiles/new.html.haml`
  - [x] `ee/app/views/projects/dast_scanner_profiles/edit.html.haml`
  - [x] `ee/app/views/projects/dast_site_profiles/edit.html.haml`
  - [x] `ee/app/views/projects/dast_site_profiles/new.html.haml`
- [x] Update path generator helpers.

title: GraphQL: Remove use of resolve procs from type definitions
description:
The new [GraphQL interpreter](https://graphql-ruby.org/queries/interpreter.html) does not support resolve procs for field definitions (https://graphql-ruby.org/queries/interpreter.html#compatibility).

We can remove these as a step to migrating to the new interpreter.

---

Typical example:

```ruby
      field :user,
            Types::UserType,
            null: false,
            description: 'The user who awarded the emoji',
            resolve: -> (award_emoji, _args, _context) {
              Gitlab::Graphql::Loaders::BatchModelLoader.new(User, award_emoji.user_id).find
            }
            description: 'The user who awarded the emoji'

```

becomes instead

```ruby
      field :user,
            Types::UserType,
            null: false,
            description: 'The user who awarded the emoji'

      def user
        Gitlab::Graphql::Loaders::BatchModelLoader.new(User, object.user_id).find
      end
```

Notice that the resolve is now a method of the same name as the field, and `object` and `context` are automatically available in the new method.

title: Remove support for Elasticsearch 6.7 and prior
description:
What concerns do we have for Self-managed customers if we removed support for Elasticsearch 6.x

When would gitlab.com move to Elasticsearch 8.0? **UPDATE**: Now Sept 2021 Release Date. 

## Steps to be compatible with 8.x

Good news per https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/247929#note_414788625 is that we'd already set up our mappings in a mostly compatible way for ES 8. Some small steps will be required to remove the redundant `_type` we are sending though.

1. Upgrade client libraries
1. Remove this `_type` being sent in bulk requests: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/94ca7fd72f3ed89e85458135bb6f05675b4b7e9b/ee/lib/gitlab/elastic/bulk_indexer.rb#L78
1. Remove this type being set in Go indexer https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-elasticsearch-indexer/-/blob/0ff0da3c0981f193929e6f82d3249b415fd5bf68/elastic/client.go#L192
1. Remove this document type being set for searches https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/94ca7fd72f3ed89e85458135bb6f05675b4b7e9b/ee/lib/elastic/class_proxy_util.rb#L15
1. There are also references to `document_type` in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/94ca7fd72f3ed89e85458135bb6f05675b4b7e9b/ee/lib/gem_extensions/elasticsearch/model/indexing/instance_methods.rb but I have a feeling this is all dead code since we should only ever be indexing documents using our custom bulk indexing code.
1. Change `nGram` to `ngram` since it was renamed after `7.6` and the old name is removed in 8 https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/94ca7fd72f3ed89e85458135bb6f05675b4b7e9b/ee/lib/elastic/latest/config.rb#L84

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=bug

<!-- Describe what actually happens. -->

title: Issues not moving between board lists when grouping by epics
description:
### Summary

When we have an issue board that is grouped by epics and try move reposition or move issues within lists the request fails and return the following error:

```shell
[{"data":{"issueMoveList":null},"errors":[{"message":"The resource that you are attempting to access does not exist or you don't have permission to perform this action","locations":[{"line":2,"column":3}],"path":["issueMoveList"]}]}]
```

### Example Project

Needs to be a group with the feature flag `boards_with_swimlanes` enabled. In this case I tested it with https://gitlab.com/groups/tech-marketing/demos/gitlab-agile-demo/large-co/sector-alpha/lob-1/app-a/-/boards?milestone_title=CY20%20Q2%20Sprint%202

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Can not reposition or move issues in board lists.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

It should be possible to reposition an issue within a list or move it a different one.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

Failing request info:

![image](/uploads/1783d29799677fa3603b6957398cb598/image.png)

### Output of checks

This bug happens on GitLab.com

### Possible fixes

When testing directly with the following GraphQL mutation the action is successful

```graphql
mutation{
  issueMoveList(input: {iid: "8", projectPath: "tech-marketing/demos/gitlab-agile-demo/large-co/sector-alpha/lob-1/app-a/app-a-backend", boardId: "gid://gitlab/Board/1775038", toListId: 5125258, fromListId: 5125260}) {
    errors
  }
}
```

And comparing the `input` variables there's a discrepancy between `projectPath` values so we should check if this variable is being set properly.

If that was the case, the reason for getting the error `"The resource that you are attempting to access does not exist or you don't have permission to perform this action"` is because it's trying to find the issue with the given `iid` in a different project.

title: Geo: Rethink about the secondary editing section naming and grouping
description:
## Overview

https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/243505/designs/default.png
There are relevant discussions here, and we might need to rethink the current structure also the naming of the section.

I will keep update the description of the issue and adding related UX issues. And another issue is already merged :)

## Proposal

[Figma prototype](https://www.figma.com/file/saGpRJHaDpmWsVm1ebvtlG/247907-forms-ux-debt?node-id=1%3A81)

### Primary form fields

![Edit-primary-node-update-iteration1](/uploads/29bc3050a189082055ad4d975adfbf65/Edit-primary-node-update-iteration1.png)

- Subtext in **Tuning settings** -> `Set verification limit and frequency.`
- `Verification capacity` -> `Verification concurrency limit`

### Secondary form fields

![Edit-secondary-node-update](/uploads/535d1cab5621ece13bc4f620ae746011/Edit-secondary-node-update.png)

- `Selective synchronization` -> `Synchronization settings`
- Subtext in the **Synchronization settings** -> `Set what should be replicated by this secondary node.`
- Having a help text under **Selective synchronization** dropdown
  -> `Choose specific groups or storage shards`
- Subtext in the **Tuning settings** -> `Limit the number of concurrent operations this secondary node can run in the background.`
- Field name of `xxx capacity` -> `xxx concurrency limit`
   - `Repository synchronization concurrency limit`
   - `File synchronization concurrency limit`
   - `Container repositories synchronization concurrency limit`
   - `Verification concurrency limit`

title: Add Require user password to approve to group level
description:
### Problem to solve

<!-- What problem do we solve? Try to define the who/what/why of the opportunity as a user story. For example, "As a (who), I want (what), so I can (why/value)." -->

In pursuit of the holistic solution outlined in https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/4367, this issue is a smaller implementation issue to iteratively move elements of project-level merge request approval rules to the group-level.

Please see https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/4367 for the discovery and implementation discussion.

### Intended users

* [Cameron (Compliance Manager)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#cameron-compliance-manager)
* [Sidney (Systems Administrator)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sidney-systems-administrator)

### User experience goal

<!-- What is the single user experience workflow this problem addresses? 
For example, "The user should be able to use the UI/API/.gitlab-ci.yml with GitLab to <perform a specific task>"
https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/ux/ux-research-training/user-story-mapping/ --> 

A `group owner` can configure this setting - `Require user password to approve` - at the group level.

### Proposal

<!-- How are we going to solve the problem? Try to include the user journey! https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/journeys/#user-journey -->

This should be behind a ~"feature flag".

Add the setting `Require user password to approve` to the group level.

**Stretch Goal:** `Enabling` this setting should inherit it down to all projects, but still allow `maintainers` to change this setting.

## Implementation plan

~frontend - :one: 

- [ ] Add `Require user password to approve` checkbox, which takes account of higher-level restrictions (instance or group when used on a project)
- [ ] Add the ability to save this value via the store
- [ ] Check that success and errors are being handled by the stores existing process
- [ ] Add tests

### Further details

<!-- Include use cases, benefits, goals, or any other details that will help us understand the problem better. -->

We should build this behind a ~"feature flag" so we can complete the entire implementation before enabling that flag by default. This should help us ensure there's a solid UX that accounts for the different preferences our users have around inheritance and enforcement.

title: Search results filters should have a `clear` behavior
description:
<!-- What is the problem and solution you're proposing? This content sets the overall vision for the feature and serves as the release notes that will populate in various places, including the [release post blog](https://about.gitlab.com/releases/categories/releases/) and [Gitlab project releases](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/releases). " -->

### Problem to solve

One of the basic interaction with the search page is selecting the scope of the search, i.e.

  - In all of GitLab
  - In a specific group
  - In a specific project

![Search result page filters](/uploads/1ad95538be31c6c8a81bf215c22908d5/image.png)
*Fig 1. Search result page filters*

To achieve this, the user must change two drop-downs (see Fig. 1) to the following combination:

  - In all of GitLab (Any, Any)
  - In a specific group (Group, Any)
  - In a specific project (Group, Project)

Each time the user want to select the `Any` choice, they have to wait for the drop-down to be loaded, which can be quite long (> 1s)

<!-- What problem do we solve? Try to define the who/what/why of the opportunity as a user story. For example, "As a (who), I want (what), so I can (why/value)." -->

### Intended users

Any user of GitLab.

<!-- Who will use this feature? If known, include any of the following: types of users (e.g. Developer), personas, or specific company roles (e.g. Release Manager). It's okay to write "Unknown" and fill this field in later.

Personas are described at https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/

* [Cameron (Compliance Manager)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#cameron-compliance-manager)
* [Parker (Product Manager)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#parker-product-manager)
* [Delaney (Development Team Lead)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#delaney-development-team-lead)
* [Presley (Product Designer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#presley-product-designer)
* [Sasha (Software Developer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sasha-software-developer)
* [Devon (DevOps Engineer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#devon-devops-engineer)
* [Sidney (Systems Administrator)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sidney-systems-administrator)
* [Sam (Security Analyst)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sam-security-analyst)
* [Rachel (Release Manager)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#rachel-release-manager) 
* [Alex (Security Operations Engineer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#alex-security-operations-engineer)
* [Simone (Software Engineer in Test)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#simone-software-engineer-in-test)
* [Allison (Application Ops)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#allison-application-ops) 
* [Priyanka (Platform Engineer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#priyanka-platform-engineer)
* [Dana (Data Analyst)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#dana-data-analyst)
-->

### User experience goal

<!-- What is the single user experience workflow this problem addresses? 
For example, "The user should be able to use the UI/API/.gitlab-ci.yml with GitLab to <perform a specific task>"
https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/ux/ux-research-training/user-story-mapping/ --> 

We want our users to achieve their search faster, and thus reduce the time they wait while making the interaction. Changing the scope of a search should not be something one as to wait for.

### Proposal

<!-- How are we going to solve the problem? Try to include the user journey! https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/journeys/#user-journey -->

#### Solution 1) Make the `Any` choice always loaded

Instead of having a spinner cover the full drop-down content, move the `Any` option at the top and make sure it is always selectable, even while fetching the drop-down elements. 

#### Solution 2) Add a `clear` button to the drop-down, to automatically set it back to `Any`

![Clear button](/uploads/5feb8d4e6b99507fc1513cd0ff3f9eea/image.png)  
*Fig. 2 Clear button on the Group filter*

### Further details

<!-- Include use cases, benefits, goals, or any other details that will help us understand the problem better. -->

### Permissions and Security

<!-- What permissions are required to perform the described actions? Are they consistent with the existing permissions as documented for users, groups, and projects as appropriate? Is the proposed behavior consistent between the UI, API, and other access methods (e.g. email replies)?
Consider adding checkboxes and expectations of users with certain levels of membership https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/permissions.html
* [ ] Add expected impact to members with no access (0)
* [ ] Add expected impact to Guest (10) members
* [ ] Add expected impact to Reporter (20) members
* [ ] Add expected impact to Developer (30) members 
* [ ] Add expected impact to Maintainer (40) members
* [ ] Add expected impact to Owner (50) members -->

### Documentation

<!-- See the Feature Change Documentation Workflow https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/workflow.html#for-a-product-change

* Add all known Documentation Requirements in this section. See https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/feature-change-workflow.html#documentation-requirements
* If this feature requires changing permissions, update the permissions document. See https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/permissions.html -->

### Availability & Testing

If there is no way to measure success, link to an issue that will implement a way to measure this. -->

title: Quoted search term breaks code highlighting
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

<!-- Summarize the bug encountered concisely. -->

Code search highlighting works unless the search term is quoted. 

### Steps to reproduce

<!-- Describe how one can reproduce the issue - this is very important. Please use an ordered list. -->

Highlighting works searching for `SearchHelper`

https://gitlab.com/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&snippets=&scope=&repository_ref=&search=SearchHelper&group_id=9970&project_id=278964

<details>
<summary>`SearchHelper` screenshot</summary>
![image](/uploads/fec9f681e06890c6ae805c83393e8a9f/image.png)
</details>

Highlighting does not work if the term is `"SearchHelper"`

https://gitlab.com/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&snippets=&scope=&repository_ref=&search=%22SearchHelper%22&group_id=9970&project_id=278964

<details>
<summary>`"SearchHelper"` screenshot</summary>
![image](/uploads/8fc6633a181986542bb5e8aca26312b8/image.png)
</details>


### What is the current *bug* behavior?

<!-- Describe what actually happens. -->

Code highlighting does not highlight exact matches.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

<!-- Describe what you should see instead. -->

Exact matches should be highlighted.


### Possible fixes

<!-- If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem. -->

The code highlighting is done through Elasticsearch and probably there is some configuration that can be adjusted there.

title: List epics on epic boards ordered by relative position
description:
Epics on epic boards should be ordered by its relative position (similar to issue boards).

* this relative position should be scoped to boards (e.g. an epic may have different relative position on different boards)
* this board relative position is unrelated to the epic's existing `relative_position` attribute which is used in epic tree ordering (IOW we should not reuse this attribute)

To implement this feature, the steps might be:
* add a new table for storing epic relative positions per board
* the model can re-use `RelativePositioning` concern
* when listing epics in a board list (https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/233436), perhaps we can use `left join` to join epics with its relative position (there may be `null`/missing positions for epics) and order epics by this relative position
